summary: The Presidential Security Resources Reimbursement Act of 2025 authorizes the Secret Service to reimburse state and local governments for the use of their services, personnel, equipment, and facilities when providing security for the President. It amends Title 18 of the United States Code and includes a provision for retroactive reimbursement, potentially back to July 12, 2024. The bill aims to compensate local entities for assisting the Secret Service in presidential protection.
